channel.title: Drummers
channel.description:
I was wondering if anyone else here plays drums. Here's my setup atm, I play in a deathmetal band.
[b]Cymbals (from left to right):[/b] 14" Zildjian ZBT Hi-hat, 16" Zildjian ZBT Crash, 10" Zildjian ZBT Splash, 18" Wuhan China, 18" Zildjian ZBT Crash, 20" Zildjian ZXT Platinum Ride
[b]Acoustic drums:[/b] Professional Ludwig Black set, I can't remember all of their dimensions.
[b]Other hardware:[/b] Cowbell (needs more, fuck yeah), pearl double bass pedals.
Here's a picture, and yeah I know I need new drum heads. :) [img]http://sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash1/hs800.ash1/169066_488232130893_695630893_6548995_88337_n.jpg[/img]

item.title: Drummers
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“flamehair9, post:28, topic:379136”]yo blake, do u like all that remains?[/quote]Yuppers.

Chassy13:

@Blake: Any tips on practicing double bass?

It just takes time and practice, although I always tap my feet when I’m away from my drum set (heel down, even though I play heel up). I’m almost always tapping my feet with the bass riffs when I’m listening to music (especially more technical drummers like Chris Adler of Lamb of God).

Read full topic

I used to play drums but not anymore. I got started in school and played for roughly 2-3 years.

Nice drum kits but I am afraid I got rid of mine quite a long time ago. I now play the acoustic guitar.

item.title: Drummers
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Pearl drums <3. If I were rich enough I would buy some Pearl drums. I had some Zildjian cymbals but over time I had beaten the shit out of them. Got some Paiste instead. I like them. I need to tune my floor tom. It’s way out of tune. And tuning drums is a bitch…

Read full topic

item.title: Drummers
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:25, topic:379136”][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=474986.msg3476554#msg3476554 date=1295744500]
It’s interesting that you place your snare there (instead of between your legs), any reason why?
[/quote]

Not really. Most of the reason would probably be because the kits at my school had it the same way, so I got used to it like that. I’ll try and put it closer to me sometime and see how it feels though as I haven’t really messed around with it too often. I’m still working on my double bass feel (I just got them around 1-2 weeks ago, so I am a beginner on those :P)[/quote]Double bass is a lot of fun. Hopefully I’ll be able to get some decent recordings of my band soon.
Most of the time the snare goes between your legs (and your feet on the double bass), it’s just easier to hit it in fills and stuff that way.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

blakeman8192:

It’s interesting that you place your snare there (instead of between your legs), any reason why?

Not really. Most of the reason would probably be because the kits at my school had it the same way, so I got used to it like that. I’ll try and put it closer to me sometime and see how it feels though as I haven’t really messed around with it too often. I’m still working on my double bass feel (I just got them around 1-2 weeks ago, so I am a beginner on those :P)

item.title: Drummers
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

blakeman8192:

Post your setup?

Set: Pearl FZ Forum Black Kit

Cymbals: All Zildjian ZBT: 18" Crash, 16" Crash, 14" Hi-Hats
I also have an unknown brand of a splash cymbal that came with a snare drum that I bought before I had a drum set. It sounds bleh but it can be used in some situations…I think. I also have all of the default cymbals the set came with, which I have an order already sent in for another cymbal stand.

Drums: All of them are the default that came with the set. I haven’t had much money to replace any heads or anything, but they sound pretty decent for the price I bought it for. I also still need to put something in my bass.

Accessories/Hardware - Mapex Falcons Double Bass Pedals, Vic Firth isolation headphones, I also have another snare drum at my other house if I wanted to go double snare.

The fact that drums are expensive and you never feel like you have enough of them doesn’t mix well.

Anyway, here are some pictures:

IMG_0199.jpg800×600

IMG_0205.jpg800×600

IMG_0206.jpg800×600

IMG_0204.jpg600×800

Read full topic

item.title: Drummers
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:21, topic:379136”]You have a nice set-up by the way. I just bought some new Zildjian cymbals like a week ago so I am going to be breaking them in as soon as my isolation headphone iPod adapter arrives. I am sure any drummer can agree that you can never have too many cymbals. :P[/quote]Agreed, if I had money to spend I’d have a smaller splash cymbal and a smaller china cymbal, maybe another crash.
Also, I’d like another floor tom. 3 toms just doesn’t feel like it’s quite cutting it for me.

Post your setup?

Read full topic

item.title: Drummers
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

asyo4:

Yay! I’ll post mine soon. My dad was in a band called Aftershock and he was in a few magazines in Germany, he is an AMAZING drummer, we have 4 full drum sets, electric guitar, microphone, acoustic guitar, bass guitar, keyboard and more. We have a specific room just for music etc.

1.21 jiggawatts?!?!?!

Seriously though dude that’s awesome, I wish my parents were into that stuff haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Drummers
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:9, topic:379136”]I really want a double bass pedal… Here’s my setup. Not that nice, don’t have a lot of money. But it works. All cymbals are Paiste. OrbiTone drum set. With an evans snare. 20" medium ride, 16" medium crash, 14" medium hats. Don’t remember drum dimensions either. Got a blanket in the bass. Rate, Hate, Masturbate excessively.
[/quote]

Looks exactly like my old setup. Pretty smooth.

Read full topic
